#Text=3 .
#Text=Racialised Immigrant
#Text=Other to Australia
#Text=One of the reasons for immigrating to Australia is to further my education and develop skills required to compete in today ’s world .

#Text=When I arrived in Australia in 2010 , I was particularly impressed with the multiracial , multicultural and multiethnic landscape of Australia , the quality of services provided by universities and government entities , and the low levels of racial violence .

#Text=I still remember how the custom officer treated me politely on my arrival and said to me , ‘ Welcome to Australia . ’ However , with time , I became more aware of my difference and how it impacts on my life chances .
#Text=The blatant and sometimes subtle forms of discrimination that I was experiencing contradicted the words of welcome .

#Text=Gradually , I became interested in understanding the role of racialised identity constructions and the mediating effects of skin colour on racialised immigrants to Australia , which became one of the motivations for undertaking my doctoral studies .

#Text=As a black Nigerian immigrant negotiating identity and belonging in Australia , the motivations for the doctoral project come from my personal experiences and passion for social justice , and inclusion for individuals , families and communities .
#Text=The project has an overarching theme in social justice and the need to improve conditions for marginalised and oppressed groups in society .
#Text=It provides a better understanding of the experiences of and the problems-that-matter for some of Australia ’s most recent immigrant communities .

#Text=It examines the experiences of African migrants and refugees living in Queensland6 , with an aim to develop a better understanding of their race , health , education and migration status and their everyday life .

#Text=By addressing race relations as an important driver of disadvantage , the project extends upon existing understanding of black Africans in Australia and raises more questions for building a more integrated , just and socially inclusive Australia where all are given a fair go .
#Text=The empirical investigation utilises both qualitative and quantitative methods of data collection to allow a useful analysis of some of the complexities of the challenging topic .
#Text=The theoretical approach synthesises concepts from critical perspectives from across the humanities , health and social sciences .

#Text=The project sheds light on the circumstances of African immigrants in Australia , making a useful contribution to practice , public policy , social and community services and the growing body of work that seeks to better understand how to work with marginalised communities in Australia .
#Text=I began the project wanting to learn more about the black African experience in Australia as racialised black subjects .
#Text=Though I have lived the very experiences I wanted to research , the motivation to undertake the research project should not be seen as lacking objectivity .
#Text=Rather , my doctoral project highlights my passion for social change , justice , equality , inclusion and human rights .

#Text=Even when I was doing the research , some members of the African community , including some participants , were worried not just about the outcome of the research , but also about what will happen to me and other black Africans in Australia for doing the research .
#Text=For example , a participant , Loretta , asked :
#Text=“ Why did you choose this topic ? ”

#Text=This question was not because the topic appeared irrelevant to her , but she was a bit afraid that I might wake up the sleeping lion to my detriment and the detriment of other black Africans in Australia .
#Text=While another participant , Aaron , told me that my project “ is very interesting , ” he cautioned me .
#Text=He said ,
#Text=“ You do not have to take all I have said … You have to be careful .
#Text=You have to be eclectic .
#Text=Ph.D. is not an end ; Ph.D. is just a means .
#Text=”
#Text=Another participant , Ricky , advised me .
#Text=In Ricky ’s own words ,

#Text=“ What I might advise you to do is to make the blame for them not to be as hard , to see the truth in a way that they may understand it . Even though the truth is quite hard and bitter at times , but it needs to be said . We are here now in Australia and some of us believed that this is our home . ”
#Text=If not for my passion and interest in social justice , social inclusion and and human rights , I would not have gone into nor continued nor completed my doctoral studies .

#Text=Given the fears and concerns in the community about my health and well-being , and about how white Australians would react , including the admonitions that I received for even trying to investigate the lived experiences of racialised black Africans in Australia , I was really close to quitting my doctoral project .
